result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward,  DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF: Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 4:14 p.m.  Includes case 15CF496, 15CF503 & 15CM654.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Attorney Chapman recites the agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF496.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF496. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 15CF496 & reads in and dismisses 15CF503 for purposes of sentencing argument & dismisses 15CM654. Crt will order the DE to receive a long form PSI and a COMPAS Evaluation and be completed no later than 05/16/16.  Set out for SEH.  Crt orders:  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF: Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 4:07 p.m.  Includes case 15CF503, 15CF496 & 15CM654.  State has made an offer.  DE is asking for time to consider it.  Set out for Plea hearing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 4:09 p.m. lw  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L. Hartung, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 11:18 a.m.  Includes case 15CF496, 15CF503 & 15CM654.   State needs more time to for further investigation into the DE's background.  Continue the PTC.   Bail is continued.  lw  Court adjourned at 11:19 a.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,  ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Mark Drew Biller DF:  Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 3:40 p.m.  Includes case 15CF496, 15CF503 & 15CM654.  Court proceeds with preliminary hearing on 15CF496.  S/T of Sgt. Jeff Kennett of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Nieskes.  Cross by Attorney Biller.  Witness excused.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court proceeds with the preliminary hearing on 15CF503.  S/T of Detective Veronica Koehler of the New Richmond Police Department.  Direct by ADA Nieskes.  Cross by Attorney Biller.  Re-direct by ADA Nieskes.  Attorney Biller makes argument.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 3:57 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing at 11-03-2015 02:45 pm

Includes 15CF496 and 15CF503

 and  _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $15000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond. 

SURETY NAME/S: Greg and Barb DeRoiser.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.C.C., M.S.J., their familes and their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
